page.title: 06HERB FARM, NESSCLIFFE
page.content: Oak Cottage became a herb farm about l6 years ago when Mrs Ruth Thompson moved to Nesscliffe. It caters for the general public not commercial use. Plants grown are for culinary, medical and decorative purposes. Also old cottage roses, geraniums, rockery and ground cover plants. Most herbs are perennials, some are bi-annuals. Teas are made from various plants. In the herbs shop Mr Thompson's home made ice cream and honey is for sale. Plus potpourri, books, herb pillows(which induce sleep) lavender bags, oils, seeds and dried herbs for winter use and spices. My Mum, Mrs Taylor, used to work there.
